azure.title: Azure
azure.notConfigured: This gateway isn't yet registered with Azure Active Directory.
azure.configureHelp: Using Azure AD as your identity provider for Windows Admin Center allows you to set up conditional access policies, such as multi-factor authentication.
azure.setupAad: Set up Azure AD authentication for this gateway
azure.modifyOrDisableAad: Modify or Disable Azure AD authentication for this gateway

ConfirmationDialog.Message:
Do you want to to continue editing or discard your changes?: 
 unsaved changes: {0}
ConfirmationDialog.Title: You have unsaved changes

access.description: Add groups to control who can access the gateway. Multi-factor authentication requires gateway users be in one of the allowed groups and authenticate with a secondary group, such as a group that provides smartcard authentication.
access.addSecurityGroupMessage: Groups in which SME checks for membership
access.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete {0}?
access.learnMore: How to register a gateway with Azure
access.learnMoreAboutControlling: How to control access to the gateway
access.controlUsing: Control access to the gateway using
access.onPrem: On-premises Active Directory and local groups
access.connectStep1: Download and extract the New-AadApp.ps1 script from​ this .zip file.
access.connectStep2: Open a PowerShell session and then run New-AadApp.ps1 -GatewayEndpoint <gateway-name>.
access.connectStep3: Refresh this page and come back here to finish.
access.manageDesc: By default, all members of the Azure AD tenant can access the gateway, while only local administrators on the gateway system can administer the gateway.
access.manageSubTitle: To limit access to specific groups:
access.manageStep1: Go to your SME Azure AD app in the Azure portal.
access.manageStep2: On the Properties tab, set "User assignment required" to Yes.
access.manageStep3: On the Users and groups tab, select "Add user" and assign a role to each user or group you add.
access.manageStep4: You can update user access in the SME Azure AD app anytime you want.
access.saveWarning: After changing the identity provider, everyone using the gateway will have to refresh their browsers and sign in again.
access.manageNote: By default, all members of the Azure AD tenant can access the gateway, while only local administrators on the gateway system can administer the gateway.
access.aadSuccessMessage: Successfully changed the identity provider to Azure Active Directory - refresh this page to continue.
access.adSuccessMessage: Successfully changed the identity provider to on-premises Active Directory and local groups - refresh this page to continue.

Page1.Title: Welcome to Windows Admin Center
Page1.Subtext: Windows Admin Center is a new web-based management solution from Microsoft, built to modernize and simplify administration of your Windows datacenter.

Page2.Title: Help us build the future of Management
Page2.Subtext: We are building on and improving Windows Admin Center, but we need your help to make sure it’s the best it can be. Click the link under the help section to send us feedback or suggestions. We look forward to hearing from you!

Error.FileNotFound: File not found or other network issue.
Error.OperationBlocked: This operation was blocked by role based access control settings or other network issue.
